view
Interface Client

All Known Implementing Classes:
NetworkClient
public interface Client

A simple interface for a TTT client. Clients provide the means of communication between a user (or AI) and the controller. This composes part of the View for the MVC pattern. A UI or AI module is attached to the Client and the clients attach to the controller.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Benjamin Pellittieri and Christopher Pauliks for Mustache Cash Stash

Method Summary
 void endSession(PlaceValue side)
          Requests to quit the game entirely on behalf of the client's attached user.
 boolean requestMove(int xPosition, int yPosition, PlaceValue side)
          Requests a move on the behalf of the client's attached user.

          Requests to forfeit the current game on behalf of the client's attached user.

          Instructs a Client to update its Gameboard model.

Method Detail

updateGameboard

void updateGameboard()
Instructs a Client to update its Gameboard model. A client receiving this call should attempt to retrieve a new Gameboard and update any relevant info, such as the GUI view of the Gameboard or the AI's move system for an AI attached client.

updateStatistics

void updateStatistics()
Instructs a Client to update its Statistics model. A client receiving this call should attempt to retrieve a new Statistics item and update any relevant info.

requestMove

boolean requestMove(int xPosition,
                    int yPosition,
                    PlaceValue side)
Requests a move on the behalf of the client's attached user. A client receiving this call should pass the call towards the controller along with it's relevant piece information.

Parameters:
xPosition - The x (horizontal) coordinate of the requested space to occupy
yPosition - The y (vertical) coordinate of the requested space to occupy
Returns:
Whether the move request was successful.

resign

boolean resign(PlaceValue side)
Requests to forfeit the current game on behalf of the client's attached user. A client receiving this call should pass the call towards the controller along with itself.

Returns:
Whether the request to resign was successful.

endSession

void endSession(PlaceValue side)
Requests to quit the game entirely on behalf of the client's attached user. This should also forfeit the current game (if any). A client receiving this call should pass the call towards the controller along with itself.
